metadata.title: CVE-2023-4569 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw was found in nft_set_catchall_flush innet/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c in the Linux Kernel. This issue may allow alocal attacker to cause double-deactivations of catchall elements, whichcan result in a memory leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4569` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-33-generic - 6.2.0-33.33
linux-image-6.2.0-33-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-33.33
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-33-generic - 6.2.0-33.33
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-33-generic-64k - 6.2.0-33.33
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1013-kvm - 6.2.0-1013.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1012-aws - 6.2.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1012-azure - 6.2.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-gcp - 6.2.0-1014.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-ibm - 6.2.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1013-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1013.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1013-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1013.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1012-oracle - 6.2.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1013-raspi - 6.2.0-1013.15
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1005-starfive - 6.2.0-1005.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-33.33').
linux-kvm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1013.13').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1012.12').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1012.12').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1014.14').
linux-ibm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1010.10').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1013.13').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1012.12').
linux-raspi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1013.15').
linux-starfive package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1005.6').
